simplesocial.client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • simplesocial.client.Client

  • public class Client
extends Object
    This class represent a client for the SimpleSocial social network.

    The methods that interacts with the SimpleSocial server (i.e. login, register, post, addFriend, confirmFriendship, getFriendsList, follow, search, logout) may be also called through a textual user interface using the main method.

    Author:
    Francesco Landolfi

    • Method Detail

      • loadPosts

        public static BlockingQueue<Post> loadPosts(String username)
        Loads and returns the posts database file of the user username. It must be stored in the directory located in DATA_DIR_PATH, with the name "posts-<username>.db". If the file is not found, returns a new BlockingQueue object. If an error occurs, prints an error message.
        Parameters:
        username - the name of the User who is the recipient of the posts
        Returns:
        a BlockingQueue object containing a queue of Post objects
        See Also:
        storePosts(BlockingQueue, String)

      • storePosts

        public static void storePosts(BlockingQueue<Post> posts,
                              String username)
        Stores the queue of posts posts in a file located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH, with the name "posts-<username>.db". If the file does not exist, a new file is created. If an error occurs, prints an error message.

        The resulting file may be reloaded with the method loadPosts(String).

        Parameters:
        posts - the queue of posts to be stored
        username - the the name of the User who is the recipient of the posts

      • loadRequests

        public static CopyOnWriteArrayList<String> loadRequests(String username)
        Loads and returns the friend requests database file of the user username. It must be stored in the directory located in DATA_DIR_PATH, with the name "requests-<username>.db". If the file is not found, returns a new CopyOnWriteArrayList object. If an error occurs, prints an error message.
        Parameters:
        username - the name of the User who has received the friend requests
        Returns:
        a CopyOnWriteArrayList object containing a list of String that represents the name of the User that made a friend request
        See Also:
        addFriend(String), storeRequests(CopyOnWriteArrayList, String)

      • storeRequests

        public static void storeRequests(CopyOnWriteArrayList<String> requests,
                                 String username)
        Stores the list of friend requests requests in a file located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH, with the name "requests-<username>.db". If the file does not exist, a new file is created. If an error occurs, prints an error message.

        The resulting file may be reloaded with the method loadRequests(String).

        Parameters:
        requests - the list of requests to be stored
        username - the name of the User who has received the friend requests

      • loadConfiguration

        public void loadConfiguration()
        Loads the configuration from a JSON file named "conf.json" located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH.

        The file must have the following attributes:

        • server_address: the IP of the server;
        • mc_group: the IP of the multicast group;
        • tcp_port: the TCP port of the server;
        • udp_port: the UDP port of the server;
        • mc_port: the multicast port of the server;
        • rmi_port: the RMI port of the server;
        • network_interface: the network interface used by the client.

        This method will modify the values of TCP_PORT, UDP_PORT, MC_PORT, RMI_PORT, SERVER_ADDR, MC_GROUP and INTERFACE. If the file does not exist or an error occurs, the client will use the default values.

        See Also:
        storeConfiguration()

      • storeConfiguration

        public void storeConfiguration()
        Stores the configuration in a JSON file named "conf.json" located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH.

        This method will save the values of TCP_PORT, UDP_PORT, MC_PORT, RMI_PORT, SERVER_ADDR, MC_GROUP and INTERFACE.

        The generated file may be reloaded using the method loadConfiguration()

      • getRequests

        public List<String> getRequests()
        Returns the list of friend requests (String objects representing the name of the User that made the request).
        Returns:
        a list of requests (Strings)

      • getPosts

        public BlockingQueue<Post> getPosts()
        Returns a queue of Post, in order of arrival.
        Returns:
        a queue of Post

      • getCurrentUsername

        public String getCurrentUsername()
        Returns the name of the User currently logged on the server. If no User is logged, returns an empty String.
        Returns:
        the name of the User currently logged on the server

      • isLogged

        public boolean isLogged()
        Returns true if a User is logged, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if logged, false otherwise

      • register

        public ErrorCode register(String username,
                          String password)
        Registers and logs in a User with username and password to the SimpleSocial server. Then returns an ErrorCode, which can have one of the following values:
        • ErrorCode.SUCCESS: the user is now registered and logged to the server;
        • ErrorCode.CONNECTION_ERROR: an error occurred while connecting to the server (may depends on the client!)
        • ErrorCode.FAIL: the connections was successful, but the server encountered a problem while registering the user (malformed username and/or password; username already registered).

        Note: The username must contain only alphanumerics, '.', '-' and '_', and must be 3 to 50 characters long. Same for the password, but must be long at least 6 characters.

        Parameters:
        username - name of the User to be registered
        password - password associated with the new User account
        Returns:
        an ErrorCode

      • login

        public ErrorCode login(String username,
                       String password)
        Logs in a User given username and password to the SimpleSocial server. Then returns an ErrorCode, which can have one of the following values:
        • ErrorCode.SUCCESS: the user is now logged to the server;
        • ErrorCode.USER_NOT_REGISTERED: the given username is not registered in the server;
        • ErrorCode.WRONG_PASSWORD: username exists, but the given password is wrong;
        • ErrorCode.CONNECTION_ERROR: an error occurred while connecting to the server (may depends on the client!).
        Parameters:
        username - name of the User to be logged
        password - password associated with the User account
        Returns:
        an ErrorCode

      • addFriend

        public ErrorCode addFriend(String friend)
        Current logged User sends a friend request to another User which name is friend. Returns an ErrorCode, which can have one of the following values:
        • ErrorCode.SUCCESS: the request is sent;
        • ErrorCode.USER_NOT_LOGGED: current user is not logged to the server. Possible causes are:
          • login method is not been called yet or has not returned an ErrorCode.SUCCESS;
          • current login is expired (see User.requestDuration);
          • the KeepAliveSignalHandler has not responded to a Keep-Alive signal from the server.
        • ErrorCode.TARGET_USER_DOES_NOT_EXIST: the given friend name is not been found on the server's database;
        • ErrorCode.USER_ALREADY_FRIEND: friend is already a friend of the logged User;
        • ErrorCode.REQUEST_ALREADY_SENT: logged User already sent a request to friend;
        • ErrorCode.REQUEST_ALREADY_RECEIVED: friend has already sent a friend request to logged User;
        • ErrorCode.TARGET_USER_IS_NOT_ONLINE: friend is not online;
        • ErrorCode.REQUEST_CANNOT_BE_SENT: the server encountered a problem saving the request;
        • ErrorCode.CONNECTION_ERROR: an error occurred while connecting to the server (may depends on the client!).
        Parameters:
        friend - the name of the friend to add
        Returns:
        an ErrorCode

      • confirmFriendship

        public ErrorCode confirmFriendship(String friend)
        Confirms a friend request from User friend. You can see pending requests calling the method getRequests(). Note that not all the requests can be confirmed: some of them may be expired (see OnlineUsers.logDuration). Returns an ErrorCode, which can have one of the following values:
        • ErrorCode.SUCCESS: logged User is now friend with friend (the request is removed from the database);
        • ErrorCode.USER_NOT_LOGGED: current user is not logged to the server. Possible causes are:
          • login method is not been called yet or has not returned an ErrorCode.SUCCESS;
          • current login is expired (see User.requestDuration);
          • the KeepAliveSignalHandler has not responded to a Keep-Alive signal from the server.
        • ErrorCode.TARGET_USER_DOES_NOT_EXIST: the given friend name is not been found on the server's database;
        • ErrorCode.REQUEST_CANNOT_BE_ACCEPTED: the server encountered a problem accepting the request. Possible causes are:
          • logged User is trying to accept a request that has not already received;
          • selected request is expired (in this case, the request is removed from the database).
        • ErrorCode.CONNECTION_ERROR: an error occurred while connecting to the server (may depends on the client!).
        Parameters:
        friend - the name of the friend to accept
        Returns:
        an ErrorCode

      • follow

        public ErrorCode follow(String friend)
        Follows a friend. In case of SUCCESS, current User will receive updates from followed User (every post sent from him will be received and stored). Returns an ErrorCode, which can have one of the following values:
        • ErrorCode.SUCCESS: logged User is now following friend;
        • ErrorCode.USER_NOT_LOGGED: current user is not logged to the server. Possible causes are:
          • login method is not been called yet or has not returned an ErrorCode.SUCCESS;
          • current login is expired (see User.requestDuration);
          • the KeepAliveSignalHandler has not responded to a Keep-Alive signal from the server.
        • ErrorCode.TARGET_USER_DOES_NOT_EXIST: the given friend name is not been found on the server's database;
        • ErrorCode.FAIL: the server encountered a problem. Possible causes are:
          • logged User is not a friend of friend;
          • logged User is already a friend of friend;
        • ErrorCode.CONNECTION_ERROR: an error occurred while connecting to the server (may depends on the client!).
        Parameters:
        friend - the name of the friend to follow
        Returns:
        an ErrorCode

      • getFriendsList

        public Map<String,Boolean> getFriendsList()
        Retrieves current User's friends list from the server. Returns an HashMap<String, Boolean>, where the Strings represent the the username of a friend and the Boolean his/her status (true if online, false otherwise). If an error occurs, returns null.
        Returns:
        a Map of String (username) and Boolean (online/offline)

      • search

        public List<String> search(String string)
        Searches for Users which username contains string. Returns a List of Strings containing the results retrieved from the server. If an error occurs, return null.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to search
        Returns:
        a List of usernames, or null in case of error

      • post

        public ErrorCode post(String post)
        Submits a Post. Returns an ErrorCode, which can have one of the following values:
        • ErrorCode.SUCCESS: post is submitted as a new Post to the server;
        • ErrorCode.USER_NOT_LOGGED: current user is not logged to the server. Possible causes are:
          • login method is not been called yet or has not returned an ErrorCode.SUCCESS;
          • current login is expired (see User.requestDuration);
          • the KeepAliveSignalHandler has not responded to a Keep-Alive signal from the server.
        • ErrorCode.CONNECTION_ERROR: an error occurred while connecting to the server (may depends on the client!).
        Parameters:
        post - the content of the Post to be submitted
        Returns:
        an ErrorCode

      • logout

        public ErrorCode logout()
        Logs current User out. Returns an ErrorCode, which can have one of the following values:
        • ErrorCode.SUCCESS: current User is now logged out;
        • ErrorCode.USER_NOT_LOGGED: current user is not logged to the server. Possible causes are:
          • login method is not been called yet or has not returned an ErrorCode.SUCCESS;
          • current login is expired (see User.requestDuration);
          • the KeepAliveSignalHandler has not responded to a Keep-Alive signal from the server.
        • ErrorCode.CONNECTION_ERROR: an error occurred while connecting to the server (may depends on the client!).
        Returns:
        an ErrorCode

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Main method. Starts a textual user interface to interact with the SimpleSocial server.
        Parameters:
        args - unused
        See Also:
        Server
